intro: Achyronia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited achyronia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its broad, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant produces large, fleshy fruits that are typically eaten by various wildlife species. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
